The underlying principles of the justice system, particularly in the context of the Supreme Court, demand impartiality and non-partisanship. Therefore, while a Justice, like any other citizen, has a right to personal opinions, it becomes problematic when these views are vocalized publicly, potentially casting doubt on their impartiality. This is especially crucial when these statements pertain to political candidates or matters that may later appear before the court.

So, even if we admire Justice Ginsberg's bravery, it doesn't necessarily correlate with the ethics and conduct expected of a Supreme Court Justice, which should prioritize impartiality above all. Therefore, I disagree with the assertion that a "Supreme court justice can denounce a candidate" based on the reason you've provided.
